trans-unit.source: OpenAI Secret Key: Enter your generated API key or generate a new one under https://platform.openai.com/account/api-keys
Prompt-Prefix for meta description suggestions generation: Enter your instruction for generating meta description suggestions

Show raw response content of meta description suggestions: By default, the extension prepares the meta description suggestions in such a way that they can be selected via radio button. If you change the prompt prefix and no bullet point list is returned as a result, display problems can occur here. With this option you can output the raw content and select your favorite meta description via copy/paste.
Prompt-Prefix for keywords generation: Enter your instruction for generating keywords

Replace first part of generated keywords: The content generated by OpenAI is usually supplemented with a short introduction. Here you can define the part of the generated content that should be removed
Prompt-Prefix for page title suggestions generation: Enter your instruction for generating page title suggestions (IMPORTANT: response must be a bullet point list as the return is processed that way)

Show raw response content of page title suggestions: By default, the extension prepares the page title suggestions in such a way that they can be selected via radio button. If you change the prompt prefix and no bullet point list is returned as a result, display problems can occur here. With this option you can output the raw content and select your favorite page title via copy/paste.

Prompt-Prefix for Open Graph title suggestions generation: Enter your instruction for generating Open Graph title suggestions (IMPORTANT: response must be a bullet point list as the return is processed that way)

Show raw response content of Open Graph title suggestions: By default, the extension prepares the Open Graph title suggestions in such a way that they can be selected via radio button. If you change the prompt prefix and no bullet point list is returned as a result, display problems can occur here. With this option you can output the raw content and select your favorite Open Graph title via copy/paste.

Prompt-Prefix for Twitter title suggestions generation: Enter your instruction for generating Twitter title suggestions (IMPORTANT: response must be a bullet point list as the return is processed that way)

Show raw response content of Twitter title suggestions: By default, the extension prepares the Twitter title suggestions in such a way that they can be selected via radio button. If you change the prompt prefix and no bullet point list is returned as a result, display problems can occur here. With this option you can output the raw content and select your favorite Twitter title via copy/paste.

Prompt-Prefix for Open Graph description suggestions generation: Enter your instruction for generating Open Graph description suggestions (IMPORTANT: response must be a bullet point list as the return is processed that way)

Show raw response content of Open Graph description suggestions: By default, the extension prepares the Open Graph description suggestions in such a way that they can be selected via radio button. If you change the prompt prefix and no bullet point list is returned as a result, display problems can occur here. With this option you can output the raw content and select your favorite Open Graph description via copy/paste.

Prompt-Prefix for Twitter description suggestions generation: Enter your instruction for generating Twitter descriptions suggestions (IMPORTANT: response must be a bullet point list as the return is processed that way)

Show raw response content of Twitter description suggestions: By default, the extension prepares the Twitter description suggestions in such a way that they can be selected via radio button. If you change the prompt prefix and no bullet point list is returned as a result, display problems can occur here. With this option you can output the raw content and select your favorite Twitter description via copy/paste.
OpenAI Model: The id of the model which will generate the completion. See https://platform.openai.com/docs/models/gpt-3-5 for an overview of available models.

OpenAI Temperature: What sampling temperature to use, between 0 and 2. Higher values like 0.8 will make the output more random, while lower values like 0.2 will make it more focused and deterministic.

OpenAI Max-Tokens: The token count of your prompt plus max_tokens cannot exceed the model's context length. Most models have a context length of 2048 tokens (except for the newest models, which support 4096).

OpenAI Top-P: An alternative to sampling with temperature, called nucleus sampling, where the model considers the results of the tokens with top_p probability mass. So 0.1 means only the tokens comprising the top 10% probability mass are considered.

OpenAI Frequency Penalty: Number between -2.0 and 2.0. Positive values penalize new tokens based on their existing frequency in the text so far, decreasing the model's likelihood to repeat the same line verbatim.
OpenAI Presence Penalty: Number between -2.0 and 2.0. Positive values penalize new tokens based on whether they appear in the text so far, increasing the model's likelihood to talk about new topics.

Use always URL for requests: With this option you can use the corresponding URL of the page for all analyses. As a result, you have to use fewer tokens to carry out your corresponding analyses. IMPORTANT: The page must be publicly accessible (hidden pages fail and pages in a local environment lead to poor results)

Maximum characters per request: Here you can additionally limit the maximum number of allowed characters. By default, OpenAI allows a maximum of 4096 tokens per request, which corresponds to around 16000 to 16350 characters (in English). Special characters are "more expensive" than normal characters, which means that a token can sometimes be less than 4 characters. For more information see https://help.openai.com/en/articles/4936856-what-are-tokens-and-how-to-count-them
Fill Open Graph and Twitter titles: Use selected page title suggestion for Open Graph and Twitter titles
Fill Open Graph and Twitter descriptions: Use selected meta description suggestion for Open Graph and Twitter descriptions
Enter the ID of one page that is used as a detail view for news articles of the news extension
Prompt-Prefix for meta description suggestions generation of news article: Enter your instruction for generating meta description suggestions

Show raw response content for meta description suggestions of news article: By default, the extension prepares the meta description suggestions in such a way that they can be selected via radio button. If you change the prompt prefix and no bullet point list is returned as a result, display problems can occur here. With this option you can output the raw content and select your favorite meta description via copy/paste.

Prompt-Prefix for alternative title suggestions generation of news article: Enter your instruction for generating alternative title suggestions (IMPORTANT: response must be a bullet point list as the return is processed that way)

Show raw response content of alternative title suggestions of news article: By default, the extension prepares the page title suggestions in such a way that they can be selected via radio button. If you change the prompt prefix and no bullet point list is returned as a result, display problems can occur here. With this option you can output the raw content and select your favorite page title via copy/paste.
Prompt-Prefix for keywords generation of news article: Enter your instruction for generating keywords

Replace first part of generated keywords of news article: The content generated by OpenAI is usually supplemented with a short introduction. Here you can define the part of the generated content that should be removed
